title: Trusting the small farmer
vignette: You buy figs on the road from an unlearned peasant (unlearned person).  May you eat without setting aside a portion?

options.text: Eat; most unlearned person separate set-aside portions nowadays.
Re-set aside a portion before eating; doubt requires caution.

title: Feeding the needy with doubtful produce
vignette: A relief kitchen receives unportioned grain.  May volunteers serve it to beggars and army scouts?

options.text: Serve it as-is; leniency for poor and soldiers.
Must set aside a portion first, even at charitable giving’s expense.

title: Guest at an Unlearned Person table
vignette: Your host insists his food is properly portioned, but you are unsure.  Eat to preserve harmony?

options.text: Trust the host; social peace trumps doubt.
Decline or secretly set aside a portion; moral obligation first.

title: Setting Aside a Portion for another without consent
vignette: A friend’s produce lies in your house.  May you separate set-aside portions on his behalf without asking?

options.text: Yes; presumed benefit needs no permission.
No; alters his property—needs consent.

title: Partial produce—insufficient to set aside a portion
vignette: You have only a small pile of doubtfully portioned produce grain, too little to set aside every required gift. How to proceed?

options.text: Estimate minimal amounts; better partial compliance.
Do nothing until full quantity is available.

title: Marketplace labeling
vignette: A vendor marks baskets “Set-Aside Portions Taken.”  Later one is found unportioned. Hold him liable for all sales that day?

options.text: Yes; buyer relies on seller’s word—compensate.
No; presume mix-up—only that basket is suspect.

title: Mixture of Doubtfully Portioned Produce with portioned produce
vignette: Equal sacks of doubtfully portioned produce and definitely-portioned wheat are poured together.  Must you re-set aside a portion the whole?

options.text: Yes; doubt spreads to every kernel.
Sample & set aside a portion proportionally; avoid waste.

title: Cooking Doubtfully Portioned Produce for others
vignette: A caterer cooks doubtfully portioned produce stew and later learns of the doubt.  Serve or discard?

options.text: Serve after separating set-aside portions on the remainder.
Discard entire batch; cooking didn’t fix the doubt.

title: Ship-board snack sales
vignette: Sailors buy fruit from itinerant traders on a boat where setting aside a portion is impractical. Eat now or wait?

options.text: Eat; in-transit leniency applies.
Wait and set aside a portion at port.

title: Produce bought from non-members inside the homeland
vignette: You purchase olives from a non-member farmer within the homeland.  Treat as doubtfully portioned produce or as exempt from set-aside portions?

options.text: Exempt—ownership by non-member waives set-aside portions.
Treat as doubtfully portioned produce—doubt about prior handling.
